Dear Katrina Dahl Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or
otherwise suggesting physical or emotional harm to a
youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 grabbed Youth A’s throat and Youth A sustained a
scratch.
Investigation I spoke to Administrator 1 on 1/9/2024 and discussed
allegations. No new information was provided.
I left a voicemail for Complainant 1 on 1/9/2024. I have not
received a call back at this time.
I left a voicemail for JJ Worker 1 on 1/9/2024. I have not received
a call back at this time.
I spoke to DHHS Worker 1 on 1/9/2024. Allegations and
scheduling were discussed.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility with
DHHS Worker 1 on 1/12/2024:
Youth A
Youth A reported he had a computer from school in his backpack.
He was searched and his computer was found by staff. Supervisor
1 told him he needed to give him the computer and Youth A
reported he needed it for school. Supervisor 1 called him “slow”
and Youth A reported Supervisor 1 was mocking his intelligence.
Youth A reported he was frustrated and slammed his hands on the
desk. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 grabbed his neck and let him
go quickly. Youth A reported Supervisor 1 left a mark on his neck.
I observed the mark to be a one-half inch scratch on his neck.
Youth A reported he did not attempt to punch Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 1 did not touch him anywhere else. Youth A reported
he told Administrator 1 what happened in the unit and then
AWOL’d.
2

Supervisor 1
Supervisor 1 reported he was at the front desk when Youth A
asked about his laptop. Supervisor 1 reported they could not give
it to him because he was not supposed to have it. Supervisor 1
reported Youth A clenched his fist, yelled at him and walked
towards him. Supervisor 1 reported he told Youth A, “I’m not going
to get hit” and put up both of his fists in a fighting stance to block
himself from being hit if Youth A went after him. Supervisor 1
reported he then “extended his arm” to block Youth A from getting
near him. Supervisor 1 reported he never touched Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported he never grabbed Youth A’s throat or
scratched him. Supervisor 1 reported he did not follow the
behavior management plan that is taught at the facility. Supervisor
1 reported he has not been trained to put up his fists in order to
block someone. Supervisor 1 reported he should have left the
area. Supervisor 1 reported he never name called Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported he was recently hit by youth and was on
medical leave for that separate incident. Supervisor 1 was
adamant that he was not going to be hit by youth again. It was
asked if he was able to still do his job with that mentality and he
was unsure.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 said he was present during this incident; however, he was
engaged in completing other tasks during this time. Therefore, he
did not observe any physical interactions between Youth A and
Supervisor 1.
Video Review:
I reviewed the video for the allegations on 1/8/2024. Youth A and
Supervisor 1 were at the staff table. Supervisor 1 pointed his
finger at Youth A while walking towards him. Youth A did not yell
or move towards Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 was verbally engaged
with Youth A. Youth A slapped his hands on the table and then
brought his right hand down in front of his body. Supervisor 1
blocked Youth A’s right arm with his left hand and then Supervisor
1 extended his left arm out towards Youth A and pushed him
back. Video footage was viewed from two directions. Both views
show Youth A being pushed back.
Documents:
• Supervisor 1 personal file: All trainings and clearances
were up to date, and he had no disciplinary action in his
file.
3

• Medical Document: Body Chart completed on 1/13/2024.
Youth A had redness, but the nurse wrote it could be from
acne as well. Report stated Youth A claimed Supervisor 1
attempted to grab his neck, but Youth A was able to pull
away.
• Incident reports dated 1/8/2024: None of the documents
reported the aggressive behavior between Youth A and
Supervisor 1.
• Incident Report #1: At 4:05pm Youth A AWOL’d, no
physical management reported, no injury.
• Incident report #2: At 4:30pm Youth A was caught
stealing, no injury. Both incident reports were written on
1/8/2024.
• Principles of Disengagement for Crisis Prevention
restraint module. Pushing is not a disengagement
technique.
Analysis Based on interviews with Youth A and Supervisor 1, Supervisor 1
did not follow behavior management techniques taught by the
agency. Supervisor 1 reported he put his fists up and extended his
arm to block Youth A. The video clearly shows Supervisor 1
pointing his finger at Youth A while walking towards him and
verbally engaged. Although Youth A made movement with his
hand towards Supervisor 1, Supervisor 1 did not use the
techniques outlined in CPI to disengage. By his own admission,
Supervisor 1 reported he was not taught to react this way and
should have left the area. Supervisor 1’s body language and
movement towards Youth A did not aid in deescalating the
situation. His behaviors were threatening in manner.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 allegedly used derogatory names towards Youth A.
Investigation Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility with
DHHS Worker 1 on 1/12/2024:
4

Youth A:
Youth A reported he had a computer from school in his backpack.
He was searched and his computer was found. Supervisor 1 told
him he needed to give him the computer and Youth A reported he
needed it for school. Supervisor 1 called him “slow”. Youth A
reported Supervisor 1 was mocking his intelligence.
Staff 1:
Although Staff 1 was present during the incident and didn’t
observe the interactions, he had the ability to hear Youth A and
Supervisor 1. During this time, Staff 1 reported he did not hear any
name calling or derogatory remarks from Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he never named called Youth A. Supervisor
1 reported he told Youth A, “I’m not going to get hit” and put up
both of his fists in a fighting stance to block himself from being hit
if Youth A went after him.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate Supervisor 1 used derogatory
names towards Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
Description program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not complete incident reports according to policy.
Investigation
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility with
DHHS Worker 1 on 1/12/2024:
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported he did not write an incident report for him
and Youth A engaging in an altercation. Supervisor 1 reported
whoever witnessed the event should have written the incident
report.
5

Documents:
• Reporting and Documenting Critical Incidents Policy:
Staff must complete incident reports that involve…any
unusual or extraordinary events…unusual incidents include
all of the out of ordinary events…aggression or
violence…Procedures: By the end of the shift (1) staff must
complete incident reports in its entirety by the end and turn
in to the designated boxes (2) The shift supervisor will
review the incident report for errors and add comments if
necessary.
• Incident reports dated 1/8/2024. None of these
documents reported the aggressive behavior between
Youth A and Supervisor 1.
• Incident Report #1: At 4:05pm Youth A AWOL’d, no
physical management reported, no injury.
• Incident report #2: At 4:30pm Youth A was caught
stealing, no injury.
Both incident reports were written on 1/8/2024.
Analysis The agency failed to write an incident report describing the details
of Youth A and Supervisor 1’s interactions. There was aggression
from Supervisor 1 and Youth A, and this was not documented.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
